title: NEXUS Chest CT Decision Instrument for CT Imaging
description: Identifies blunt trauma patients with clinically significant chest injuries. The NEXUS Chest CT-All version uses 7 criteria to determine which patients require CT chest imaging after blunt trauma.

parameters.name: abnormal_chest_xray
parameters.description: Abnormal chest X-ray showing any thoracic injury or widened mediastinum

parameters.name: distracting_injury
parameters.description: Presence of a distracting painful injury

parameters.name: chest_wall_tenderness
parameters.description: Tenderness to palpation of the chest wall

parameters.name: sternal_tenderness
parameters.description: Tenderness to palpation of the sternum

parameters.name: thoracic_spine_tenderness
parameters.description: Tenderness to palpation of the thoracic spine

parameters.name: scapular_tenderness
parameters.description: Tenderness to palpation of the scapula

parameters.name: rapid_deceleration
parameters.description: Rapid deceleration mechanism: fall from >20 feet (>6 meters) or MVA >40 mph (>64 km/hour) with sudden deceleration

result.name: nexus_chest_ct_score
result.description: Number of positive NEXUS Chest CT criteria

ranges.interpretation: No NEXUS Chest CT criteria are present. Major or minor thoracic injury can be excluded without CT chest imaging. The negative predictive value is 98.7% for all thoracic injuries.

One or more NEXUS Chest CT criteria are present. Major or minor thoracic injury cannot be excluded. Further workup is indicated, potentially including CT chest. This rule is 99.0% sensitive for all thoracic injuries and 100% sensitive for aortic and great vessel injuries.

references: Rodriguez RM, Langdorf MI, Nishijima D, Baumann BM, Hendey GW, Medak AJ, et al. Derivation and validation of two decision instruments for selective chest CT in blunt trauma: a multicenter prospective observational study (NEXUS Chest CT). PLoS Med. 2015 Oct 6;12(10):e1001883. doi: 10.1371/journal.pmed.1001883.

Rodriguez RM, Hendey GW, Mower W, Kea B, Fortman J, Merchant G, et al. Derivation of a decision instrument for selective chest radiography in blunt trauma. J Trauma. 2011 Sep;71(3):549-53. doi: 10.1097/TA.0b013e3181f2ac9d.
formula: NEXUS Chest CT Score = Number of positive criteria (0-7)
